meanings.definition: A slight knowledge or suspicion; a hint.
meanings.sent1: She had an inkling that it might rain later in the day.
meanings.sent2: He had an inkling of what the surprise gift could be.
meanings.sent3: With just an inkling, she guessed the answer to the riddle.
meanings.sent4: The inkling of doubt grew into a full-blown worry.
meanings.sent5: The faint inkling of a memory lingered in the back of his mind.

meanings.definition: A slight understanding or vague idea.
meanings.sent1: There was an inkling of how the magic trick worked.
meanings.sent2: She had an inkling that the story would have a happy ending.
meanings.sent3: His inkling of the foreign language made him feel like a spy.
meanings.sent4: The inkling of a plan formed in her mind as she listened.
meanings.sent5: The inkling of a solution sparked a glimmer of hope in his eyes.

meanings.sent1: There was not an inkling of sugar left in the jar.
meanings.sent2: He found an inkling of hope in the darkest of times.
meanings.sent3: The inkling of a smile played on her lips as she remembered the joke.
meanings.sent4: The inkling of a scent wafted through the room, triggering memories.
meanings.sent5: An inkling of regret crept into his heart as he realized his mistake.
